title: KDP Niche Research Four Strategies For Finding Winning Low Content Book Niches

tactics.name: Amazon Search Expansion
tactics.description: Use Amazon's search suggestions and Book Bold to identify niches with existing search volume.

tactics.name: Demand Validation
source_quotes: we want to find niches where there is a true demand

tactics.name: Amazon Suggestion Expander
tactics.description: Expands Amazon search results to uncover sub-niches and longtail keywords for low-content book opportunities
steps: Use Chrome extension to expand search terms
Validate niche demand via Amazon search results
Check BSR and review counts for product validation
caveats: May fail to find niches with extremely low search volume
source_quotes: this helps us find some of these extra niches that might be a little bit more untapped

tactics.name: BSR & Search Volume Analysis
tactics.description: Identify niches with low BSR and manageable competition by analyzing search results and BSR metrics
steps: Use Amazon suggestion expander to find keywords
Check Book Bolt for total results, price ranges, and average BSR
Prioritize niches with <1M BSR and <1,000 search results
caveats: High competition niches may require unique value propositions
source_quotes: we want to see that there's more products that have at least under 1 million BSR

tactics.name: Passion Niche Exploration
tactics.description: Leverage hyper-specific interests with strong buyer intent
steps: Research passion niches via Google searches
caveats: Some passion niches may have limited market size
source_quotes: passion niches are those niches that people are very passionate about

tactics.name: Sub-Niche Targeting
tactics.description: Identify specific geographic or thematic sub-niches by appending location/state or activity-specific keywords to base terms.
steps: Niche down further if competition is high
source_quotes: we could create one for each state maybe you're in a different country so you create them for different countries as well

tactics.name: Book Type Analysis
tactics.description: Use specific book formats or functional types (e.g., habit tracker, guest journal) to uncover underserved niches.
caveats: Requires further refinement to avoid broad keywords
source_quotes: we could use the type of book instead of our main keyword and let's do a habit tracker

heuristics.name: Review Count Filter
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niche
source_quotes: anything less than that's amazing right if we can find something with a hundred or two hundred

heuristics.name: Search Volume Threshold
source_quotes: we see about a thousand results which you know is not bad

heuristics.name: Low-Competition Filter
heuristics.condition: If BSR exceeds 500,000 and review count exceeds 200, then flag for further refinement
source_quotes: we see 200 results again we see the average BSR here is 1.5 millions

claims.statement: KDP niches with no existing search volume are unlikely to succeed
source_quotes: it's a lot easier to find a market...

claims.statement: Low-content books with BSR under 500,000 show potential demand
source_quotes: this one is showing that it's doing roughly 140 units per month

claims.statement: Book Bolt provides sales estimates and BSR averages for niche validation
source_quotes: we can see that average BSR is 1.1 million

claims.statement: Books with BSR below 500,000 can achieve 100+ units sold per month
source_quotes: this one is doing four hundred and seventy four units per month

niche_patterns.description: Combines specific audience identity with problem and constraint for niche targeting
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages low review counts and specific constraints
source_quotes: we want to find niches where there is a true demand

niche_patterns.description: Combine niche specificity with practical tools and market constraints
source_quotes: we're seeing people are doing disc golf scorecards specifically

niche_patterns.description: Combine physical activity with geographic location and functional purpose for targeted niches
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Limits competition while maintaining search volume
source_quotes: we could have a cover now that would be something about kayaking in Florida
